title: I Can't Even Balance My Personal & Work Life, This Dog Can Balance Almost Anything On Its Head!
text:
I Can't Even Balance My Personal & Work Life, This Dog Can Balance Almost Anything On Its Head!

I Can't Even Balance My Personal & Work Life, This Dog Can Balance Almost Anything On Its Head!

I can’t balance by personal and work life properly, and this dachshund is going viral online for being able to balance literally anything and everything on its head.

Paul Lavery was astonished to discover his dog Harlso’s talent of balancing things, when he randomly placed a toy on its head. The pup stood still as a statue and did not let the toy fall. There was no turning back then, literally. The little guy in its jazzy bow-tie, can balance a bottle, donuts and toys on its head.

Instagram

Doing what anyone would do after discovering the crazy talent of their pet, Paul made an Instagram page dedicated only to Harlso’s balancing skills. The daschund now has a blue tick account and over 100 k followers - he is officially a star.

"We got him five years ago and we just fell in love with him at first sight and brought him home. For us, we didn't know he knew any tricks, we tried teaching him to sit, lie down, roll over and he wasn't interested," Lavery reportedly said. He along with his partner, Jen Scott, 29, lives in Belfast, Ireland.

Instagram

He further said, "When he was about two years old I sat a chicken toy on his head and he just sat there looking at it really still. I called Jen down and said, 'Jen! Harlso has a hidden talent!'"

Talking about the Instagram followers and popularity, Lavery reportedly said, "It really started growing quite quickly. People from all over the world follow him. When we created the Instagram account it was mainly just for us, family and friends. We never expected it to take it off."

Instagram

"I just thought: 'Who is going to be interested in seeing these photos and videos?’” he recalled. “Harlso's got his very own VIP fan club for the most dedicated fans and we get messages through from people wanting to meet him.”

The couple only gives the daschund to balance things that are safe to balance.

I cannot believe that I have seen a day where I feel jealous of a dog’s social life and balancing skills.
